com.camerontec.catalys.server.collection

Class BoundedPersistentBlockingQueue<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.collection.PersistentBlockingQueueBase<E>
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.collection.BoundedPersistentBlockingQueue<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - The element type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPeekableBlockingQueue<E>, Iterable<E>, Collection<E>, BlockingQueue<E>, Queue<E>

    public final class BoundedPersistentBlockingQueue<E>
extends PersistentBlockingQueueBase<E>
    A bounded blocking queue implementation which stores its elements persistently.

    This implementation makes use of a persistent java.util.List implementation which maintains its indices in memory. Therefore, there is a practical limit to the maximum number of elements in the queue at any time. However, the memory consumed by each index (and therefore element in the queue) is low (about 8 bytes) and so the queue is still able to accommodate reasonable capacities. Consider using the UnboundedPersistentBlockingQueue when a bounded implementation is not sufficient. Depending on the capacity and usage, this implementation is likely to provide higher throughput then the unbounded implementation.

    This implementation does not support iteration in the presence of concurrent modifications and the associated behavior is undefined.

    See Also:
    ICollectionRegistry, CollectionProperties, IBytesSegmentExternalizer, UnboundedPersistentBlockingQueue

        capacity - The maximum number of elements allowed in the queue at any time.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - On one or more invalid arguments.
        NameNotFoundException - On failure to locate the collection registry service.
